DataElement.preferredName: Chest Computed Tomography Neoplasm Maximum Diameter Length Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the measurement of the maximum diameter of tumor as examined through body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis of the part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chest Computed Tomography Neoplasm Maximum  Diameter Length
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the maximum diameter of tumor as examined through body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis of the part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.:Length; the linear extent in space from one end to the other.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement
